t: A Man With a Measuring Line
Then*p I looked up, and there before me was a man with a measuring line in his hand.
I asked, “Where are you going?” He*p answered me, “To measure Jerusalem, to find out how wide and how long it is.”
While*p the angel who was speaking to me was leaving, another angel came to meet him
and said to him: “Run, tell that young man, ‘Jerusalem will be a city without walls because of the great number of people and animals in it.
And I myself will be a wall of fire around it,’ declares the Lord,*s ‘and I will be its glory within.’
“Come!*p Come! Flee from the land of the north,” declares the Lord,*s “for I have scattered you to the four winds of heaven,” declares the Lord.*s
“Come,*p Zion! Escape, you who live in Daughter Babylon!”
For this is what the Lord*s Almighty says: “After the Glorious One has sent me against the nations that have plundered you—for whoever touches you touches the apple of his eye—
I will surely raise my hand against them so that their slaves will plunder them. Then you will know that the Lord*s Almighty has sent me.
“Shout*p and be glad, Daughter Zion. For I am coming, and I will live among you,” declares the Lord.*s
“Many nations will be joined with the Lord*s in that day and will become my people. I will live among you and you will know that the Lord*s Almighty has sent me to you.
The Lord*s will inherit Judah as his portion in the holy land and will again choose Jerusalem.
Be still before the Lord,*s all mankind, because he has roused himself from his holy dwelling.”
